resources.string: I do not have an account
Powder coating is a type of paint that is applied to metal and some other surfaces, usually using an electrostatic application system. Features and advantages of powder coating include:

Powder coating is sprayed onto a metal surface, usually via an electrostatic gun or machine. In this process, the metal surface has a positive electrical charge, while the powder coating carries a negative charge. This allows the powder particles to be attracted to the surface, creating a homogeneous coating.
Thanks to the electrostatic application system, the adhesion efficiency of powder paint to the metal surface is quite high. This means less paint consumption and lower costs.
Powder coating generally does not contain solvents and has lower VOC (Volatile Organic Compounds) emissions. Therefore, it is considered an environmentally friendly paint option.
Powder coating offers a wide range of colors. Many color tones can be achieved by mixing different pigments.
Powder coating generally provides a durable finish and provides good protection to metal surfaces. Additionally, it tends to achieve a smooth and uniform surface finish.
